hypothesis_content.title: Failed Bear Market Breakdown Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BEAR or STRESS regime, a breakdown below a major support level (e.g., 200-day SMA) that fails to sustain lower prices and closes back above the level within 24 hours signals an exhaustion sell-off and triggers a sharp, short-covering rally of 8-12%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear markets are driven by pessimism and shorting. A breakdown that immediately reverses suggests all weak hands have been flushed out and aggressive shorts are now trapped. The failed breakdown becomes a powerful liquidity event for the opposing side.
entry_conditions: In BEAR/STRESS regime, price trades below the 200-day SMA (breakdown)
Within 24 hours, price closes back above the 200-day SMA (failure signal)
The 4-hour RSI shows a bullish divergence (higher low) during the breakdown

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price rallies 10% from the entry close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the low of the initial breakdown candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If more than 50% of such failed 200-day SMA breakdowns are followed by price making a new low within the next 5 days (i.e., the failure is itself a bull trap), the hypothesis is falsified.
